title: What GOP presidential candidates are saying about abortion a year after Dobbs
description: GOP presidential candidates flocked to the Faith and Freedom Coalition's annual conference Friday to pitch religious Republicans on their positions on abortion.

title: RFK Jr. divides social media platforms with vaccine misinformation
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his presidential campaign have flourished online, and that’s putting some tech platforms in a difficult position.

title: NHL teams won't wear theme-night jerseys after players' LGBTQ Pride refusals
description: NHL teams won’t wear special jerseys for pregame warmups during themed nights next season, the result of a handful of players refusing to use Pride jerseys this past season.

title: Chris Christie, jeered for criticizing Trump, tells crowd: 'You can boo all you want'
description: Former New Jersey Gov. Chris Christie was booed while addressing a gathering of top conservatives after he accused Donald Trump of failing the Republican Party.

title: InfoWars host Owen Shroyer pleads guilty in Jan. 6 case
description: A host from Alex Jones' conspiracy theory mongering InfoWars on Friday pleaded guilty to storming the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Iowa meteorologist quitting TV, cites PTSD from death threat over climate change coverage
description: An Iowa meteorologist will be leaving his career on television, citing harassment over his coverage of climate change and its impact on weather, he said Friday.

title: Russia doubles down on dolphin defenses to guard against Ukrainian attacks
description: Ukrainian attacks have seen Russia bolster its defenses with trenches and mines.

title: Meta to pull news from Facebook and Instagram in Canada
description: Meta has announced it would shut down access to news on Facebook and Instagram in Canada after the country’s federal government passed the Online News Act, or Bill C-18, a law mandating that tech companies pay content fees to domestic media outlets.

title: Supreme Court revives Biden immigration enforcement plan
description: The Supreme Court breathed new life into a Biden administration policy that will set immigration enforcement priorities by focusing on public safety threats.

title: Is Twitter ready for Europe’s new Big Tech rules? E.U. official says it has work to do
description: Twitter needs to do more work to fall in line with the European Union’s tough new digital rulebook, a top E.U. official said after overseeing a “stress test” of the company’s systems in Silicon Valley.

title: Decision to burn chemicals after Ohio derailment under scrutiny at hearing
description: The decision to vent and burn five train cars’ carcinogenic chemicals in East Palestine, Ohio, in February came under renewed scrutiny Thursday as federal investigators questioned officials in the community still reeling from the aftermath of a toxic train derailment.

title: Judge blocks Wyoming's 1st-in-the-nation abortion pill ban
description: Abortion pills will remain legal in Wyoming for now, after a judge ruled the state’s first-in-the-nation ban won’t take effect July 1 while a lawsuit proceeds.

title: 'Rust' weapons expert passed drugs to someone else on day of fatal shooting, prosecutors say
description: Hannah Gutierrez-Reed “did transfer narcotics to another person with the intent to prevent the apprehension, prosecution or conviction of herself,” the special prosecutors appointed in the case said in a Santa Fe County court filing.

title: Oklahoma death row inmate rejects clemency hearing because he says it won't make a difference
description: Anthony Sanchez, 44, said in a telephone interview Thursday from Oklahoma’s death row that even in the rare case when the five-member Pardon and Parole Board recommends clemency, Gov. Kevin Stitt is unlikely to grant it.

title: Collapsed stretch of Interstate 95 in Philadelphia to reopen
description: Interstate 95 was set to reopen to traffic Friday less than two weeks after a deadly collapse in Philadelphia shut down a heavily traveled stretch of the East Coast’s main north-south highway.

title: How a personal experience with abortion is guiding the Senate Democrats' campaign chair
description: Sen. Gary Peters, the first sitting senator to share his abortion story, is using that experience as he prepares to guide Democrats through the 2024 elections.

title: ‘Catastrophic implosion’ fuels grief and search for answers
description: ‘Catastrophic implosion’ fuels grief and search for answers

title: A firefighter and his wife had been trying to have a baby for years — then a newborn was left at his station
description: A firefighter in Ocala, Florida, was pulling an overnight shift at the station in January when he was awakened at 2 a.m. by an alarm.

title: Lawyer for Ye dismisses 'dystopian' claims about Donda Academy, asks judge to dismiss suit
description: A lawyer for the rapper formerly known as Kanye West asked a judge to dismiss a lawsuit from former teachers at his private Southern California Christian school, saying in court documents filed this week that depictions of Donda Academy as a “dystopian institution designed to satisfy Ye’s idiosyncrasies” were false.

title: Hunter Biden, fresh off his plea agreement, attends state dinner at White House
description: Hunter Biden, who is expected to plead guilty to two federal misdemeanor counts of failing to pay his taxes, attended a state dinner for Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
